name: Aromatic Malt
description: A kilned barley malt used to give beer a strong, aggressive malt aroma and rich color.

name: Biscuit Malt
description: Used in English ales, brown ales and porters. Adds a biscuit-like flavor and aroma.

name: Caramunich Malt
description: Caramel, copper colored malt. Used in Belgian ales and German bocks.

name: Caravienne Malt
description: Light Belgian crystal malt. Used in light Trappist and Abbey style Belgian ales.

name: Pale Malt
description: A standard base malt for many beer recipes.

name: Pilsner Malt
description: Base malt for Belgian beer styles.

name: Special B Malt
description: A dark, flavorful crystal malt traditionally malted in Belgium. In small amounts, it gives a unique flavor to the finished beer that is often compared to raisins or dried fruit.

name: Wheat Malt
description: Malted wheat base for use in all wheat styles.

name: Acidulated Malt
description: A type of malted barley which contains a small proportion of lactic acid. Traditionally used by German brewers to adjust malt PH without chemicals to adhere to German purity laws.

name: Brumalt
description: Dark German malt developed to add malt flavor of Alt, Marzen and Oktoberfest beers. Helps create authentic maltiness without having to do a decoction mash.

name: Chocolate Wheat Malt
description: Intensifies aroma and color in top-fermented beers such as dark wheat beers.

name: Dark Wheat Malt
description: Dark malted wheat base for use in dark wheat styles such as Dunkleweizen.

name: Melanoidin Malt
description: Aromatic malt from Bamberg, Germany. Promotes a full flavor and rounds off beer color. Promotes deep red color and malty flavor.

name: Munich Malt
description: Munich Malt has a malty sweet flavor characteristic and adds a reddish amber color to the beer.

name: Pilsner Malt
description: German base malt for Pilsners and Bohemian Lagers.

name: Smoked Malt
description: Malt that has been smoked over an open fire to create a distinctive "smoked" flavor and aroma. Used primarily for German Rauchbier but can also be added to Brown Ales and Porters.

name: Vienna Malt
description: A kiln-dried barley malt darker than pale ale malt, but not as dark as Munich Malt. It imparts a golden to orange color and a distinctive toast or biscuit malt aroma to the beer.

name: Wheat Malt
description: Malted wheat base for use in all wheat styles.

name: Amber Malt
description: Roasted specialty malt used in some English browns, milds and old ales to add color and a biscuit taste.

name: Brown Malt
description: Imparts a dry, biscuit flavor. Used in nut brown ales, porters and some Belgian ales.

name: Chocolate Malt
description: Dark malt that gives a rich red or brown color and nutty flavor. Maintains some malty flavor, but not as dark as roasted malt.

name: English Mild Malt
description: A light specialty malt used in Brown Ales.

name: Maris Otter
description: A premium base malt from the UK.

name: Pale Malt
description: Base malt for English beer styles.Lower diastatic power than American 2 Row.

name: Peat Smoked Malt
description: Robust smoky malt that provides a smoky flavor. Used in scottish ales and wee heavy ales.

name: Pilsner Malt
description: Pilsner base malt for English beer styles.

name: 2-Row Malt
description: A standard base malt for many beer recipes.

name: 6-Row Malt
description: A base malt with a higher diastatic power than 2-Row Malt to help convert other adjuncts.

name: Black Barley
description: Unmalted barley roasted at high temperature to create a dry, coffee-like flavor. Imparts the sharp, acrid flavor characteristic of dry stouts.

name: Black Patent Malt
description: Provides dark color and dry roasted flavor characteristic of Stouts and Porters.

name: Chocolate Malt
description: A dark malt that gives a rich red or brown color and a nutty flavor. Used in brown ales, porters, and some stouts.

name: Corn Grits
description: Imparts a corn or grain taste. Mash required. Used to increase gravity of American lagers.

name: Crystal 10L
description: This light malt will lend body and mouth feel with a minimum of color, but with a light caramel sweetness.

name: Crystal 20L
description: This malt will provide a golden color and a sweet, mild caramel flavor.

name: Crystal 40L
description: This malt will lend a balance of medium caramel color, flavor, and body.

name: Crystal 60L
description: This malt will lend a well rounded caramel flavor, color and sweetness.

name: Crystal 80L
description: This malt will lend a well a pronounced caramel flavor, color and sweetness.

name: Crystal 90L
description: This malt will lend a well a pronounced caramel flavor, color and sweetness.

name: Crystal 120L
description: This malt will lend a complex sharp caramel flavor and aroma to beers. Used in smaller quantities this malt will add color and slight sweetness to beers, while heavier concentrations are well suited to strong beers.

name: Cara-Pils/Dextrine
description: Significantly increases foam/head retention and body of the beer.  Also sold under the names "Dextrine" and "Cara-Foam".

name: Flaked Barley
description: Adds significant body to Porters and Stouts. High haze producing protein prevents use in light beers.

name: Flaked Corn
description: Generally a neutral flavor, used to reduce maltiness of beer. Produces beer with a milder, less malty flavor.

name: Flaked Oats
description: Adds body, mouth-feel, and head retention to beer. Used in oatmeal stouts and porters.

name: Flaked Rice
description: Used to add fermentables without increasing body or flavor. Produces a milder, less grainy tasting beer.

name: Flaked Rye
description: Imparts a dry, crisp rye flavor. Can be easier to mash than raw rye.

name: Flaked Wheat
description: Increases body and foam retention. Used in place of raw or torrefied wheat for faster conversion and better yield.

name: Raw Barley
description: Unmalted barley which can be used to add body to your beer. Use in homebrew requires very fine milling combined with a decoction or multi-stage mash.

name: Torrefied Barley
description: Raw barley that has been "popped" open to open kernels. Used in place of raw barley for faster conversion and higher yields. High in haze-producing protein.

name: Torrefied Wheat
description: Raw wheat that has been "popped" open to open kernels. Used in place of raw wheat for faster conversion and higher yields. High in haze-producing protein.

name: Munich Malt - 10L
description: Provides a malty-sweet flavor characteristic and adds a slight orange color to the beer.

name: Munich Malt - 20L
description: Provides a malty-sweet flavor characteristic and adds an orange to deep orange color to the beer.

name: Rye Malt
description: Adds a dry, crisp character to the beer.  Yields a deep red color, and a distinctive rye flavor.

name: Special Roast
description: Used in English ales, nut brown ales and porters. Adds a toasted, biscuit-like flavor and aroma.

name: Toasted Malt
description: A malt that adds reddish orange color and body without adding sweetness.

name: Victory Malt
description: Toasted malt that adds a nutty, biscuit, and/or toasted flavor to English ales.

name: White Wheat Malt
description: White wheat gives a malty flavor not available from raw wheat.  Used in Weiss, Wit and White beers.
